Class Animation

java.lang.Object
game.util.Animation
public class Animation extends Object
The Animation class represents a simple frame-based animation system for cycling through an array of images at a specified delay.

This class allows you to create an animation by providing an array of images (frames) and a delay between frame transitions. It automatically updates the current frame when the specified delay has elapsed.

  • Field Details

    • frames

      private city.cs.engine.BodyImage[] frames
      An array of images (frames) used in the animation. Each element represents one visual frame in the sequence.

    • currentFrame

      private int currentFrame
      The index of the current frame in the animation sequence. This value cycles through 0 to frames.length - 1.

    • lastFrameTime

      private long lastFrameTime
      The timestamp (in milliseconds) when the current frame was last updated. This is used to determine when to switch to the next frame.

    • frameDelay

      private long frameDelay
      The delay (in milliseconds) between frame transitions. Once the delay has passed, the animation progresses to the next frame.

  • Constructor Details

    • Animation

      public Animation(city.cs.engine.BodyImage[] frames, long frameDelay)
      Constructs an Animation instance with the given frames and frame delay.
      Parameters:
      frames - An array of BodyImage objects representing the animation frames.
      frameDelay - The time in milliseconds between frame changes.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentFrame

      public city.cs.engine.BodyImage getCurrentFrame()
      Returns the current frame of the animation.

      This method checks whether the delay period has elapsed since the last frame change. If so, and if the animation contains more than one frame, it advances to the next frame. The frame index is cycled using modulo arithmetic so that the animation repeats.

      Returns:
      The current BodyImage frame.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the animation to the first frame.

      This method also updates the lastFrameTime to the current time, ensuring that the frame delay is recalculated from the time of the reset.
